page.title: 11BITTESWELL AIRPORT
page.content: The{airport}opened in September 1939. Aircrew from all over the Commonwealth trained on Wimpey aircraft, to fly Wellington bombers. In the grounds are traces of huttments used to house the personnel,then German & Italian prison -ers of war & finally Ukrainian & East European displaced persons. From the war until 1984 the{airport} was owned by British Aerospace & used for development & service of aircraft, including the Red Arrows team. It was then sold to Mr Arnold who intends to rehouse his wartime aircraft here. The {airport}is still open for freight and privately owned aircraft. The licence needed for fare paying passengers has not been renewed this year. There are 12 hangers,3 runways - 6,000, 4,228 & 4,200ft. long & 150ft. wide, control tower, fire & safety equipment. Three hangers now house{surplus E.E.C. grain
